TopicTitle: Millennium Falcon - but this one has a trick up its sleeve!

Articles.Content:
Yeah I know... another one... but this one has a functional interior. With holochess table ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/0UCoVH62soE?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

> [Javascript is disabled. View full album](//imgur.com/a/6qxqD)

Craft File: [http://www./download/jeaapn4eiw8e2j3/Millenium_Falcon.craft](http://www./download/jeaapn4eiw8e2j3/Millenium_Falcon.craft)

That is very impressive! +rep

P.S.

Have you considered using the coupla instead of the mk 1-2 pod?

Yeah I did consider, however if you look at the YT-1300 cockpit, it resembles the MK1-2 more (in my opinion) and also offers more than just one seat. 

And thanks for the rep, I appreciate it ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
This is just awesome, very well done man i could not have done as good as this.
How well does it fly? Did you have to tweak some of the engine outputs, or is there enough gimble that the CoM doesn't give you much problems?

> 
> How well does it fly? Did you have to tweak some of the engine outputs, or is there enough gimble that the CoM doesn't give you much problems?

The vertical engines are placed in such a way that I did not need to adjust any thrust output. The aft Aerospikes have different throttle output levels to compensate the offset center of mass. But if you take this thing as it is, activate infinite fuel (which you must, because fantasy tech ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif) ) and throttle up, it should fly straight. With RCS and the reaction wheels included it's a non-issue.
What about part count? Before I download this, I want to make sure my little laptop doesn't die.

U just inspired me to make an internal in my new frigate class capital ship. Im going to most likely simplify it by utilizing the outer hull as the inner walkways ect, as its already nearing 200 parts without any crew parts added to it (i like my ships below 200 parst so i can have a formation of 3-4 and not lag to death).

Great job on the internal, im impressed.

I made a ship with internals too now, thx for inspiration (despite the fact that the entire cockpit/front has no armor, makes it kinda crap in combat).

> [Javascript is disabled. View full album](//imgur.com/a/2OhEN)

Thats my ship with internals, now im actually kinda tempted to try to rebuild my SSTO capable Normandy replica with internals, how epic would dat be!

internals are like image 10 or so, there are a few shots of external 1st, and at the way end some shooting.

Now im off to bring back my age old SR-1 replica, that thing with a properly made internal space will be the single most amazing thing ever. the original didnt have internals but it was large enough to accomodate a small crew space, new one will be ebigger, just as SSTO capable, and hopefully have enough space to give it an authentic internal, with everything from command deck, to the underside where that rover thing was as well as engine room.
